Zeeka,Not everyone who comes to this forum reads every thread. Even regular posters these days seem to just read a few. So, to make sure the info is out there and available to everyone e no matter what threads they're choosing to read I post info in more than one thread If I think it's something important. If you don't like it then kindly skip over it. As for posting something others already did then again skip over it. In fact, skip over all my posts if you like. There's quite a few duplicate posts on here by many people. Again for the reason that not everyone read a all the threads. And I think they will likely continue until this situation changes. Bottom line is I'm trying to helpful but sometimes I don't have time to read through every post myself before posting what I think is helpful and useful information. So I'm not always aware If it has already been posted. If you don't appreciate that or find it annoying then so be it. But I have absolutely NEVER been rude to you and fail to see why you felt it necessary to make the comment that started this chain of thought. I have treated you with nothing but respect yet you feel it's okay to use my name as an adjective. I don't understand that way of thinking and never will.

WorldTraveler, I can understand your wish to protect yourself in a crowded situation, however everyone must also understand that those in primary need of protection do not have enough to do so. My son who is a doctor saw a patient who ended up testing positive for coronavirus and he was not wearing protective gear. His gf is a nurse and is given one mask at the start of a 12 hour shift and told to make do. Those masks are supposed to be changed frequently and that is not happening. If our healhcare workers cannot be protected they will get sick or have to isolate and then we will be in an even worse situation than we are now.I looked out my window yesterday and saw someone wearing a mask while walking their dog. No one else about. I had to stop myself from screaming at them to wise up and leave the masks for the primary line.
